Administrative Manager Job at Kanselor Business Innovation Campus Limited




        
    

        
        Kanselor Business Innovation Campus Limited is a Business operation management, market storm promotion, recruitment, product lauch and sales inventory management.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative Manager
Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	Responsible for managing administrative operations, coordinating clearing and forwarding processes, ensuring regulatory compliance, and supporting smooth cargo movement across departments.


Key Responsibilities

	Manage daily administrative operations and office logistics.
	Handle all clearing and forwarding documentation (Form M, PAAR, BoL, IDR, Exit docs, etc.).
	Liaise with Customs, shipping lines, terminals, and regulatory agencies for timely cargo release.
	Track shipments and provide updates to management and clients.
	Supervise administrative staff and ensure adherence to company policies.
	Maintain accurate documentation, records, and audit-ready files.
	Support operations and logistics teams to prevent shipment delays.


Key Requirements


	HND qualification / B.Sc Degree in Business Administration, Logistics, or a related field.
	Mandatory experience in Freight Forwarding / Clearing & Forwarding (3 - 5 years).
	Must be male and not more than 35 years of age.
	Strong knowledge of customs procedures and port operations.
	Excellent communication, leadership, and organizational skills.
	Ability to multitask and work under pressure.
	Proficient in Microsoft Office.


Salary
N300,000 / Month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: nkem.kiyix@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Non Manager Engineer Job at Multinet Group Ltd




        
    

        
        Multinet Group Ltd is a leading investment holding and service provider company based in Abuja, Nigeria, offering diverse solutions across multiple sectors. Our expertise includes oil and gas, Engineering Procurement, Construction, Installation and Commissioning (EPCIC); General contracting; Security and Surveillance; and Real Technical Consulting. With a commitment to sustainable growth and innovation, we provide exceptional and pioneering business solutions and sustainable services to clients in both the public and private sectors, ensuring our relevance in an ever-changing global market.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Non Manager Engineer
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Oil & Gas bid document preparation
	Contract negotiation with external vendors e.g NNPC, Shell, Napins, NPDC and other IOCs
	Obtain permits and licenses from appropriate authorities
	Plan all construction operations and schedule intermediate phases to ensure deadlines will be met
	Design, analyse, and implement engineering solutions in support of oil and gas operations and related infrastructure.
	Review engineering specifications, drawings, and project documentation to ensure compliance with technical and safety standards.
	Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams (civil, mechanical, electrical, process, and project management) to deliver project objectives.
	Conduct feasibility studies, site assessments, and technical evaluations for new or ongoing projects.
	Supervise installation, maintenance, and commissioning of systems and equipment as applicable.
	Monitor project execution to ensure adherence to scope, budget, and quality targets.
	Prepare technical reports, documentation, and interface with clients, consultants, and regulatory authorities.
	Support continuous improvement, safety, and operational efficiency initiatives within project teams.
	Ensure adherence to all health and safety standards and reports issues


Requirements


	The candidate must have an engineering and administration related experience. He/she must have a high drive in restructuring and transformation and also result oriented in businesses that are used to assessing manager’s based KPI and results.
	He or she must also have the ambition and energy to deliver on projects transcending what the group is doing.
	Excellent leadership skills with ability to work as a team leader, supervisor and manager and also special skills in detecting rare talent and nurturing such talent is also essential.
	The right candidate must be methodical in his or her approach with a multi-talented background, with a “willing” and ready to learn “approach” He or she must also be able to demonstrate a understanding. Other useful experience in IT, Legal and Accounting are also an added advantage.
	He must have proficiency Certification in Computer Packages in relation to the job, working knowledge of any or 2 of the following AutoCad, Archid, Civilcad Orion.
	Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
	Proven ability to work independently and as part of a multidisciplinary project team.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and cover letter to: multinetrecurit@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Investment Analyst",
  "description": "Onyx Investment Advisory Limited&nbsp; -&nbsp;We Are More Than Just a Leading Investment Advisory Firm Based in Nigeria. We Are Driven by A Powerful Mission: &lsquo;Invest with Purpose. Change The World.&rsquo; With Unwavering Commitment, We Focus on Investment Promotion, Facilitation, International Project Development and Private Sector Development Events to Ignite Economic Growth and Create Investment Opportunities in The Region. As A Strategic Partner for Businesses and Investors Seeking to Capitalise on The Potential of The Nigerian Market, We Believe In &lsquo;Investing with Purpose, Change the World.&rsquo; Our Comprehensive Range of Services, Including Private Sector Development, Market Research, Project Management, Investment Promotion and Facilitation, All Align with Our Vision to Make a Meaningful World Through Purpose-Driven Investments.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Investment Analyst

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (with occasional travel within and outside Nigeria)
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports to:&nbsp;Investment Promotion Lead

Role Overview


	The Investment Analyst will provide high-quality analytical, coordination, and research support to the Investment Promotion Lead across multiple mandates.
	The role requires a high performing, globally minded professional capable of turning ideas into bankable opportunities by building pipelines, preparing documentation, coordinating stakeholders, and ensuring engagements meet international standards in investment promotion, blended finance, and project development.
	This position functions as the operational engine behind the Lead - translating strategy into structured analysis, clean documentation, dashboards, and consistent follow-through.


Key Responsibilities
Research, Market Intelligence &amp; Knowledge Management:


	Conduct sector and policy research across priority industries (e.g., agriculture, energy, infrastructure, creative economy, healthcare, manufacturing).
	Profile investors, DFIs, funds, corporates, and development partners, mapping mandates, instruments, ticket sizes, and recent transactions.
	Track macroeconomic, regulatory, and policy developments relevant to investment promotion and blended finance in Nigeria and partner countries.
	Maintain knowledge repositories including investor databases, pipeline trackers, sector briefs, and document libraries.
	Prepare concise research notes, slide decks, and talking points for meetings, pitches, and workshops.


Pipeline Development &amp; Project Preparation:


	Support the identification, screening, and classification of project/SME pipelines using agreed criteria.
	Gather and organize data from project sponsors/SMEs (financials, business model, impact metrics, governance, legal structure).
	Contribute to project proposals, investment summaries, presentations, and reports in line with best practice.
	Assist in risk assessment using structured frameworks (financial analysis, value chain mapping, risk registers).
	Support development and updating of project opportunity matrices.


Investor, Donor &amp; Partner Engagement Support:


	Prepare briefing packs and profiles ahead of meetings, roadshows, and workshops.
	Draft high-quality correspondence, follow-up notes, and meeting summaries for the Lead and senior management.
	Track action points from engagements with DFIs, donors, banks, corporates, and government agencies, ensuring follow-through.
	Support planning of investment promotion events, roundtables, webinars, and roadshows (logistics, invite lists, materials, pre-reads, follow-up).
	Maintain a CRM-style log of investor and partner interactions aligned to each pipeline.


Analytics, Modelling &amp; Reporting:


	Assist with basic financial analysis and modelling (revenue projections, simple cash flows, sensitivity scenarios under guidance).
	Collate and validate data for KPI tracking, dashboards, and reports to clients and internal management.
	Prepare structured monthly progress reports covering pipeline status, deal stages, capital mobilised/in discussion, partnership updates, and key insights.


Process, Systems &amp; Coordination:


	Translate annual/quarterly work plans into weekly task lists and tracking sheets alongside the Investment Promotion Lead.
	Coordinate inputs from internal and external stakeholders to meet documentation and reporting deadlines.
	Ensure proper document version control, naming standards, and secure storage.
	Contribute to continuous improvement of templates, tools, and processes (investor profiles, pipeline trackers, standard templates).
	Provide administrative and coordination support (calendar scheduling, basic logistics, documentation routing).


Success in this role will be measured by:


	Quality and timeliness of analysis, documentation and reporting, and feedback from the Investment Promotion Lead and key Clients.


Profile
Education:


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Engineering, Economics, Finance, Business Administration, Development Studies, Public Policy, International Relations, Agriculture, or related fields.
	Postgraduate degree or relevant professional certification (e.g., CFA Level I, FRM, PPP, FMVA, AFM) is an advantage but not mandatory.


Experience


	2&ndash;4 years of experience in at least one of the following:
	
		Investment banking, corporate finance, or transaction advisory
		Development finance/DFI, donor-funded projects, or impact investing
		Management consulting or policy advisory
		Investment promotion agency, PPP unit, or related public-private institutions
	
	
	Exposure to projects involving DFIs, donors, VCs, PEs, blended finance instruments, guarantees, or climate/SDG-linked facilities is a strong advantage.
	Experience working with Nigerian public sector institutions is an added benefit.


Skills &amp; Competencies
Technical &amp; Analytical:


	Strong research and analytical capabilities with ability to synthesise complex information into clear outputs.
	Comfort with numbers, basic financial analysis, and simple financial modelling.
	Ability to apply frameworks (value chain analysis, risk matrices, stakeholder mapping, SDG/ESG alignment).
	Understanding of investor requirements across DFIs, donors, VCs, PEs, and commercial banks.
	Familiarity with blended finance, concessional capital, guarantees, and climate/SDG funds (or strong willingness to learn).
	High proficiency in Excel/Google Sheets, PowerPoint/Google Slides, and Word/Google Docs.


Communication &amp; Writing:


	Excellent written and verbal communication; able to produce high-quality documents with minimal supervision.
	Ability to tailor messages for DFIs, donors, government agencies, investors, and SMEs.
	Experience preparing business plans, investment teasers, and pitch decks.


Mindset &amp; Behaviour:


	Strong project management and multitasking abilities with strict attention to detail.
	Proactive, solution-oriented, and able to work in a fast-paced environment.
	High integrity, professionalism, and confidentiality.
	Strong interest in Nigeria&rsquo;s development, SDGs, climate finance, and private capital mobilisation.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their cover letter and CV in PDF as a single document, attached in an email to:&nbsp;hr@onyxial.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",
